data.title: Ranked pillbox-inhabitant losing sight
data.body:
Release 20170527

1.Place a pillbox near enemy-infantry and let it kill a couple so the E1 inside will rank up 
2.Sell the Pillbox 

The ranked E1 inside will be under the fow and lose its sight

![pillshadow](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9139965/26791078/4afe3f60-4a16-11e7-9924-26e101cec889.png)

data.title: TD: AI using super weapons through fog of war?
data.body:
Release-20150527
AI: Cabal

I can accept that tiberium fields being blindly attacked with air strikes, but having an ion cannon launched at my army's staging point, in front of my base... Or is it that advanced that it can estimate that? 
Seen such AI behavior in other RTS games as well, so I thought this is not the intended behavior.

Thank you for your work!

data.title: TD: Aircraft rearming and repairing
data.body:
Release-20150527
GDI
- Chinook doesn't repair at helipad
- Orca doesn't repair at helipad
- Orca rearms itself (is this normal behavior?)
NOD
- Apache doesn't repair at helipad
- Transport doesn't repair at helipad

Not really applicable to TS yet due to #13430, unfortunately.

data.title: Aircraft leave the map
data.body: In TD, aircraft can leave the map and are then difficult to control. When orcas and apaches are towards the edge of a map, especially the corners and especially in larger groups, some will often go on an excursion. The aircraft can then only be made to return at certain angles, along certain paths. You can not bring them back directly. Left alone, the aircraft are prone to moving large distances outside of the map, even along the entire length of a map. This is easy to reproduce: build five apaches or orcas then tell them, as a group, to move to the corner of the map. Keep them selected and watch as one leaves the map and e.g. comes back to another corner. I attach an example replay (on a stock map and created in release-20170527). This issue seemed to arise a release or two ago. Perhaps it coincided with the fix to the bug that meant aircraft could not be targeted when at the very top of the map. N.B. Just remove the .txt suffix, which I had to add to get github to accept the replay upload (only certain file types are accepted) [OpenRA-2017-06-04T135454Z.orarep.txt](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/1050366/OpenRA-2017-06-04T135454Z.orarep.txt)

data.title: Map hash near the top of  a replay file sometimes doesn't correspond to the correct map
data.body:
The map hash recorded near the top of replay files sometimes doesn't correspond to the map played on. For example, in this replay:
  https://www.gamereplays.org/openra/replays.php?game=92&show=details&id=320073
the map hash toward the beginning of the file is (found, in this case, using 'less'):
        Map: 58da5c480d13a00a07c9bee00f928f70564f188f

However, the game was played on the map with hash: 
  a03d9bfa8211e6d5233b4734ae40eefe52b19de1
That hash appears later on in the replay file and OpenRA does realise which map the game was actually played on.

I suspect that this occurs when the map was changed in the lobby. It's been a minor inconvenience for me as I've often looked to see which map a game was played on by 'less'ing the top of the replay file. 

It doesn't seem to serve any purpose to have the hashes of other maps stored in a replay file. So, I wonder, would this be trivial to fix? Ideally, the correct map hash should be available near the top of the replay file. If that wouldn't be trivial to achieve then I'd leave it as is.

data.title: RA: engineers can not be placed in pillboxes
data.body:
Engineers can not be placed in pillboxes; I think that's wrong. Every other infantry units can be put in pillboxes (even spies, dogs, zombies and ants!).

You can see an example of the impact of this here:
https://youtu.be/OiKjmCXjeTA?t=160
Hi tried to save his engi from the incoming ranger but was thwarted. I have confirmed that engis will not enter pbs in release-20170527.

Apparently, it used to be possible to put engis in pbs (according to Hi). Maybe it changed when the bug that allowed MCVs to be placed in camo pbs was fixed.

data.title: Sanitize Explodes trait
data.body:
Explodes' current setup is rather unintuitive:

- [x] `Weapon` has FieldLoader.Require, but still an internal (useless) default #13342
- [ ] `LoadedChance` and `Chance` are hard to tell apart, unless you look at the code. They should be renamed to `WeaponProbability` (because it's the probability that `Weapon` will be used instead of `EmptyWeapon`) and `ExplosionProbability` (because `Chance` defines the probability the actor will explode at all) or something along those lines, respectively.
- [ ] `EmptyWeapon` is currently required to match `Weapon` if you want the actor to explode the same way all the time (i.e. regardless of whether the actor currently has ammo/payload or not). As this is the most common case (in our official mods and likely most external ones, too), we could save a bunch of yaml lines and make the trait a bit more intuitive by introducing an `AlwaysUseWeapon` boolean that does just what it implies, completely ignoring `EmptyWeapon` and payload state. This would allow us to set it to `true` on actor defaults and then only set it to false in special cases like harvesters, artillery, Grenadiers etc.

data.title: Add a VERSION file to simplify engine version checks for mods.
data.body:
Dropping support for the `RequiresMod` metadata had an unfortunate side effect of removing the only simple way we had for mods to check/force a specific engine version.  

According to @jrb0001 players with the wrong engine version desyncing games is an ongoing problem for the Crystallized Doom mod, and I need a simple way to query the engine version for the mod template.

This PR introduces a VERSION file in the source/install root that external scripts can read to get the current engine version.  This is also used ingame instead of relying on the `modcontent` mod so that third party mods are no longer forced to ship that if they don't need it.

data.title: Add unit command bar to TD.
data.body:
This implements the backend for #3789, and the frontend for TD.  The other mods will come in future PRs after this is merged.

![unitcommand](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/26754716/b9f63b98-4877-11e7-8d6f-023eea379230.png)

The bar exposes clickable UI for all the keyboard-only actions that were previously hacked into `UnitCommandWidget` (now deprecated and will be removed once the bar is implemented in the rest of the mods).

This is important for discoverability and usability / accessibility by players who may not be able to use the keyboard.  For this reason, I consider it to be an essential part of the unit stance/targeting rework that we are aiming for in the next playtest.

data.title: Add LandOnCondition to the trait Aircraft which triggers a landing and prevents takeoffs while the condition is met
Add new trait ForceReload which triggers a reload of the armaments if the condition is met
Add new trait ReloadArmamentsBar which renders a bar to show the current reload status
Add RangeCircleMode to trait RenderRangeCircle
